conclusion: To determine the number of moments when the speed is 5 m/s within the time interval from 0 to 4 seconds, analyze the slope of the displacement-time graph.

The graph shows displacement x (in meters) as a function of time t (in seconds). The curve starts at x = 10 m and decreases over time, crossing the x = 0 line around t = 2 s, and reaching x = -10 m at t = 4 s.
Velocity is the derivative of displacement with respect to time, corresponding to the slope of the tangent line to the curve at any point.
Positive slope indicates positive velocity (moving forward), and negative slope indicates negative velocity (moving backward). The magnitude of the slope gives the speed.
Find points on the curve where the slope of the tangent line equals 5 m/s or -5 m/s.
The first tangent line between 0 s and 2 s has a slope indicating a velocity greater than 5 m/s.
The second tangent line between 2 s and 4 s has a slope indicating velocity less than 5 m/s.
There are two distinct tangent lines shown, each suggesting one moment where the speed is 5 m/s (one for +5 m/s and one for -5 m/s).
There are two moments within the 0 to 4 seconds interval when the speed of the particle is 5 m/s.
